SENT.plain: Type 2 diabetes disproportionately affects the Hispanic population
New approaches are needed to provide effective education to this population
This evidence-based project utilized community health workers (CHWs) to deliver a culturally relevant diabetes education program to a Hispanic population at a migrant clinic
The program emphasized culturally relevant interventions to improve self-efficacy
Formative evaluation was used to develop and improve the program
Participants showed improvement in diabetes knowledge and diabetes related self-efficacy scores
Outcomes also included improvement in CHWs' diabetes knowledge and development of an educational program that could be utilized in other settings serving Hispanic populations with type 2 diabetes
